properties.name: Babylon
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14IraqBabylon was an ancient empire of Mesopotamia that is now known as southern Iraq. It became one of the most important countries of the ancient middle east when Hammurabi made it the capital of the kingdom of Babylonia. They used a more advanced system of math and the empire was managed by use of code, which were made out of clay. The tower of Babel is located here. Today the earliest known settlers were the Sumerians, which the Bible refers to as the people of the "land of Shinear".

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14LondonThis clock is one of London\'s best known landmarks and is probably the most famous clock face and chimes in the world. It is inside the clock tower and forms part of the house of parliment. The bell was built by Sir Benjamin Hall and when it was made it was Britain\'s heaviest bell. When the light at the top of the tower is on you will know that the house of commons are sitting. There are 35 steps leading up to the tower, but unfortunately it is not open to the public.

properties.name: Biltmore Estate
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14North CarolinaCornelious Vanderbilt was George W. Vanderbilt\'s grandad who owned a fortune in shipping and railroads. A lot of this heritage helped him build the house he lived in. From 1889-1895 George Vanderbilt built and finished his home. It is known as the largest house in America with over 250 rooms. The Biltmore house was built when many people did not have bathrooms or electricity, but their family had both electricity and 43 bathrooms. George married to Edith S. Dresser and they had one child named Cornelia. When Cornelia was older she married John Francis Amherst Cecil and their wedding was held in the Biltmore home. In 1930, the Cecil family opened up their home to the public hoping to increase area tourism during the depression. Today, William A.V. Cecil owns Biltimore.

properties.name: Bok Sanctuary
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14FloridaBok tower is located in Lake Wales and is 205 feet tall,which is the highest point in Florida. It was built in 1929 by Edward W. Bok. The tower contains 57 bronze bells that weigh up to 17 pounds to 12 tons. The bells chimed throughout the day to create a musical enhancement to the gardens. Bok tower is surrounded by gardens that were designed by Fredrick Olmstead Jr. which took a total of 5 years to complete. "Mountain Lake Sanctuary and Singing Tower" is what the tower was originally called but in 1986 it was renamed bok tower in the honor of its creator.

properties.name: Empire State Building
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14New York CityThe building was made in the great depression and is an architectural marvel and one of the most striking attractions in New York city. After it was built it was the highest skyscraper for forty years, starred in over ninety movies and is still one of New York\'s most popular places to visit. The first day that the building was completed President Hoover pressed the button to turn on all of the lights. In 1945, during the world war two, an army corps bombing plane crashed into the seventy-ninth floor.

properties.name: St. Augustine
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14FloridaSt. Augustine is the oldest permenant European settlement in the United States. August 28,1565 spanish explorer Menendez arrived on the coast of Florida. Eleven days later his soldiers and him settled at the site of a Timucuan Indian village which he later named St. Augustine. This city was found long before the Pilgrims even landed on Plymouth rock. Today people from all over the country visit here. A popular place to go is the Gonzalez-Alvarez house, known as "The Oldest House."

properties.name: The Leaning tower of Pisa
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14ItalyThis is one of the most ambitious monuments of the Tuscon Romanesque. A couple of years ago they shut it off to the public because they were scared that it would collapse. No one understands why there are problems finding a place to stabilize the building. But engineers still hope to stabalize it someday so that it will not fall and tourists can once again climb up the building to visit.

properties.name: The statue of Zeus
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14OlympiaThe Ancient Olympic games and festivals were held here in honor of their god Zeus. The olympic games were first started in 776 B.C. and they have games every four years. The maker is a man named Libon of Elis. He followed a design used on many large Grecian temples, which was considered one of the best examples for the Doric design. Today this place is known as one of the seven wonders of the world.

properties.name: Title or search term
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14Alaska, AnchorageKnown as Alaska\'s largest city. It is the hub of the state\'s communication, transportation, health care, finace, and trade industries. The city contains all of a large cities neccessities but still is surrounded by wilderness. Anchorage is home to many retail giants such as, J.C. Penney, The Body Shop, Walmart, Nordstrom, Sam\'s Club, Home Depot, Office Depot, Lowes Home Improvement Warehouse, and The Gap. The city is called, "The City of Lights and Flowers." To keep the theme residents and businesses light the city with white lights once every year in winter time.

properties.name: Title or search term
properties.description: Posted by Pkelley14Costa Rica, BrazilThey have a democratic government much like the U.S. The more conservative Social Christian Unity Party is the country\'s main rivalry. The country is divided by a row of mountains and volcanoes. Small quakes occur from time to time. The capital is San Jose. For the most part the people speak spanish and over 90% of Costa Rica are Roman Catholic. Costa Rica is probably the most sanitary Central American nations and is extremely rare for you to get a disease. Infectious hepatitus is reported rarely in Costa Rica. The basic diet of the Costa Rican diet includes: rice, beans, and tortillas. Due to the geography of the country it produces a wealth of fruits and vegetables.
